lead_paragraph: Another insect that shows that the mechanics of its limbs is more important than messages from the brain when it comes to quick movement.

headline.print_headline: Legs Give Moths a Flying Start
headline.main: Legs Give Moths a Flying Start

snippet: Another insect that shows that the mechanics of its limbs is more important than messages from the brain when it comes to quick movement.
abstract: Dr Malcolm Burrows study published in The Journal of Experimental Biology finds that some species of moths use their legs, muscles and joints to initiate flight, rather than waiting for neurons to send out signals to their brains; study results suggest that simple mechanics can take the place of complicated neurobiology.
